title: CHRIS SUTTON: The challenge by Victor Lindelof on Divock Origi was clearly a foul
text:
What is ‘clear and obvious’ then?

Do you have to smack someone with a baseball bat? Get them in a headlock? Kung-fu kick him? Crikey.

This is getting silly now. It’s either a foul or it’s not, and this challenge by Victor Lindelof on Divock Origi was definitely a foul. This whole ‘clear and obvious’ excuse has become a cop out.

VAR was controversial once again when Divock Origi looked to have been fouled by Lindelof

Marcus Rashford went on to score from the resulting phase of play for Manchester United

The television replays showed Origi getting kicked in the calf. How obvious do you want it? It was in the same attacking phase as Marcus Rashford’s goal, too, so VAR should have ruled it out.

At the very least, referee Martin Atkinson should have went to his pitch-side monitor to double-check the incident. That would have lessened the controversy, even if he decided to stand by his original decision.

This was a huge moment in a huge match, and the officials got it wrong for me. It is incidents such as this that make me lose faith in VAR.
